elements.title: Cambus O' May bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Prince Charles donated money to help repair the Cambus O' May bridge (pictured) after it was badly damaged by Storm Frank in 2015?

elements.title: Mariner 1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mariner 1, the United States' first interplanetary probe, was lost in 1962 due to the miscoding of a single character in its software?

elements.title: Hilde Scheppan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that more than fifty years after Hilde Scheppan appeared in Wagner's Die Meistersinger von Nürnberg at the 1943 Bayreuth Festival, reviewer Alan Blyth called her "a dream of an Eva"?

elements.title: Powder House Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1908, you could "throw a cat through the cracks" of the dynamite shanties on Powder House Island?

elements.title: Metridium dianthus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the sea anemone Metridium dianthus is parasitised by the sea spider Pycnogonum litorale?

elements.title: Jonathan Trichter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jonathan Trichter, a registered Democrat, was the Republican nominee for New York State Comptroller in 2018?

elements.title: scouring (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that scouring in wool is among the essential pre-treatments of textiles that prepares them for subsequent processes such as bleaching, dyeing, and printing?

elements.title: Venezuela at the 2020 Summer Olympics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Julio Mayora was most happy about winning his silver medal for Venezuela at the 2020 Summer Olympics because it meant the government might give his mother a house?
